snippet: The White House said Fadel al-Hayali was second in command to the militant group’s leader, Abu Bakr al-Baghdadi.
abstract: National Security Council issues statement announcing death of Islamic State militant Fadhil Ahmad al-Hayali, also known as Hajji Mutazz, during American airstrike near Mosul, Iraq; Hayali was member of ISIS cabinet and senior deputy to its leader Abu Bakr al-Baghdadi.

byline.original: By HELENE COOPER and RUKMINI CALLIMACHI
byline.contributor: Helene Cooper reported from Washington, and Rukmini Callimachi from Erbil, Iraq.

lead_paragraph: The White House said Fadel al-Hayali was second in command to the militant group’s leader, Abu Bakr al-Baghdadi.

headline.main: Airstrike Kills a Deputy to ISIS Leader, U.S. Says
headline.print_headline: American Attack Killed Aide to Islamic State Leader, U.S. Says

keywords.name: organizations
keywords.value: Islamic State in Iraq and Syria (ISIS)
